alert.note: Alert for Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 20 at 6:52AM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northern Florida, including the following counties, Alachua and Marion. * WHEN...Until 900 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 651 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Radar indicates 2-3 inches of rain have fallen in the warning area, with another 2-3 inches of rain possible. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Citra, Hawthorne, Cross Creek, Rochelle, Micanopy, McIntosh, Lochloosa, Grove Park and Flemington. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
